message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with the problem of vertex guarding a simple polygon, which is a classic problem in computational geometry. The paper presents approximation algorithms for guarding weakly visible polygons, which is a special case of simple polygons. This problem is closely related to the problem of guarding polygons, which is a well-studied problem in computational geometry. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CG (Computational Geometry). The paper also involves the analysis of geometric properties and the design of approximation algorithms, which are related to sub-categories such as cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics), cs.CC (Computational Complexity), and cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory).
